description.narrative: UNDP is supporting the Government of Guyana to strengthen monitoring and implementation of biodiversity-friendly practices in Guyana's gold mining sector to reduce biodiversity loss and maintain ecosystem functionality for the benefit of all Guyanese.

i. submission of Final Global Environment Facility (GEF) project document to GEF for approval no later than April 2014 and initial implementation ii. sufficient co-financing identified (4:1 match) iii percent increase in number of compliance actions taken by EPA (such as issuance of enforcement notices, laying of charges or mediation proceedings) iv percent of total high priority area being monitored using satellite tracking v. number of courses or seminars implemented through the Guyana Mining School that adequately incorporated biodiversity considerations; vi percent increase of small and medium scale miners in areas identified as high priority for monitoring and enforcement complying with the environmental regulations and codes of practice; vii percent of small and medium scale gold miners who participate in project seminars report an increased awareness of mining-related regulations and biodiversity issues. viii percent increase in number of collaborative meetings and monitoring visits for enforcement of mining-related environmental practices.
